content.text:
# Draft:Timeline of Watergate scandal reporting by The Washington Post

*May 28, 1972: Liddy's team breaks into the Democratic National Committee Headquarters at the Watergate complex in Washington, D.C. for the first time, bugging the telephones of staffers.
*June 16, 1972: early morning of June 17, 1972, five men are arrested for breaking in
*June 17, 1972: Bob Woodward, is sent to the arraignment of the burglars.
Editors and reporters
* Carl Bernstein, Reporter
* Bob Woodward, Reporter
* Benjamin C. Bradlee, Executive Editor
* Katharine Graham, Publisher
* Harry M. Rosenfeld, Metropolitan Editor "Metro Editor"
* Howard Simons, Managing Editor
* Barry Sussman, City Desk Editor
* Harry M. Rosenfeld
* Marilyn Berger
* National Editor
* News Desk Editor
* Assistant Metro Editor
Investigators
* Martin Dardis, chief investigator for the Dade County, Florida, state attorney in 1972
See also
*Timeline of the Watergate scandal
References

Crisis and Collapse in The Watergate Conspiracy
Robert R. Faulkner
University of Massachusetts Amherst
Eric R. Cheney
Central Washington University
January 11, 2012
